column4: guys, if no one can help me (http://paste.ubuntu.com/107393/) please someone give me a hint what to google for ?
your sources.list?
just a sec, ok
http://paste.ubuntu.com/107396/
you are getting an error with the google repo?
no, http://paste.ubuntu.com/107393/
any idea whats wrong ?
did you try to comment out the intrepid-updates repo? ie put a # in front of them, update and try again
ok , i will try it now, but i will loose some updates !
better yet
go to software sources and change to a different server
i have tried that before , with no success too
that is odd; what are you trying to do when this occurs
i think my ISP is using a caching server, that the checksum is outdated or the file is outdated
how can i force apt not to use cached versions on my ISP cache server ?
not sure about that one; never had experience with that
it will work certainly
have u tried it ? recommend ?
on that size screen? not really no
no, i mean have you tried it at all , regardless of screen size
yes I have. on a very small netbook though
what do you think?? is it good, bad  ?? any comments ?
